title: CPBX Device provisioning change (Workplace specific DNS label)
acceptance_criteria: The following device CustomTags must be set for new devices (SIP_1, SIP_2, PC-Client, Mobile-Client, Tablet-Client) before the device profile is assigned to a workplace.

no changes requested for the following device types
SIP_0
SIP_0_Teams
Dummy Device
SIPTrunk PBX

Flex Seating 
An eDNS label must be provided for both host and guest. If no guest is logged in, the host label is used. As soon as a guest logs in, the guest label is used

The value for the CustomTag is generated by C4 once for each workplace during the workplace creation.
Details can be found in the technical specification in the appendix (based on IMPI)
Details can be found in the technical specification in the appendix (based on IMPI)

Migration of all existing devices
for all workplaces without a value for the new custom tag, C4 has to generate a new value
for all existing devices the custom tag has to be provisioned
for all updated device profiles a rebuild must be triggert
a reset of migrated devices is not necessary.
for all workplaces without a value for the new custom tag, C4 has to generate a new value
for all existing devices the custom tag has to be provisioned
for all updated device profiles a rebuild must be triggert
a reset of migrated devices is not necessary.

Note on migration (rebuild trigger):
The migration of the devices can be completed in one step. The migration should start in the afternoon (from 4 p.m.) so that the main load on the application servers is outside of business hours. The migration date will be coordinated with the technology department and a test will be carried out to determine the load. The processing volumes in the C4 may then be adjusted for the migration.
